recipe.title: How to Make Takowasa
recipe.intro: Takowasa is a Japanese snack of raw octopus with wasabi. It is a popular side dish at izakayas.
recipe.ingredients: raw octopus (sashimi grade), wasabi, soy sauce, salt, mirin, sesame seeds, shiso leaf
steps: **Cut** the raw octopus into small bite-size pieces.
**Put** the octopus pieces in a bowl.
**Mix** the wasabi, soy sauce, and a little mirin in a small cup.
**Pour** the wasabi sauce over the octopus.
**Put** it on a plate with a shiso leaf and sesame seeds. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Sunset Wharf Kitchen at Palm Beach last Friday. It was right next to the water. I could see the sunset over the ocean. The sky was orange and pink. I ordered takowasa and it was very fresh. The wasabi was a little spicy but so tasty. The restaurant had a wooden deck and it felt very relaxing. I loved this place.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Wow, this fish market is so big!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes! There are many kinds of fish and seafood here.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: I want to buy octopus. I will make takowasa.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: It is raw octopus with wasabi. It is a Japanese snack.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Oh, that sounds interesting! Is it spicy?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: A little. But it is very good with cold beer.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I want to try it. How much octopus do we need?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: About 200 grams is enough for two people.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: OK. Let me ask the staff. Excuse me, is this octopus sashimi grade?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: He said yes. Great! Let us buy it.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I am excited to try your takowasa tonight!
